segments.source_content: This week, we have a good variety of React and React-Native content. A lot of very positive feedback from the community onÂ [Bun](https://bun.sh/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)!

segments.source_content: [**Statements Vs. Expressions**](https://www.joshwcomeau.com/javascript/statements-vs-expressions/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: Josh Comeau is preparing his next course on React. He proposes to go back to the basics of JavaScript, and thus allow a better understanding of how JSX works, which only works with expressions. On the same topic, I would love to see theÂ [do-expressions](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-do-expressions?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)Â proposal progress ğŸ˜‡.

translations.fr: Josh Comeau prÃ©pare son prochain cours sur React. Il propose de revenir aux bases de JavaScript, permettant ainsi de mieux comprendre le fonctionnement de JSX, qui ne fonctionne qu'avec des expressions. Sur le mÃªme sujet, j'adorerais voir la propositionÂ [do-expressions](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-do-expressions?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)Â progresser ğŸ˜‡.
translations.en: Josh Comeau prÃ©pare son prochain cours sur React. Il propose de revenir aux bases de JavaScript pour mieux comprendre le fonctionnement de JSX, qui ne fonctionne qu'avec des expressions. Sur le mÃªme sujet, j'adorerais voir la proposition [do-expressions](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-do-expressions?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter) progresser ğŸ˜‡.

segments.source_content: [**How to build connected components in Storybook**](https://storybook.js.org/blog/how-to-build-connected-components-in-storybook/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: An official Storybook article that explains well all you can do with decorators: add a layout, global providers, mock a Redux store or requests... It can help to add "connected" components to your Storybook that otherwise can't be rendered due to context dependencies.

translations.fr: Un article officiel de Storybook qui explique bien tout ce que vous pouvez faire avec les dÃ©corateurs : ajouter une mise en page, des fournisseurs globaux, simuler un store Redux ou des requÃªtes... Cela peut aider Ã  ajouter des composants "connectÃ©s" Ã  votre Storybook qui autrement ne pourraient pas Ãªtre rendus Ã  cause de dÃ©pendances de contexte.

Cela peut aider Ã  ajouter des composants "connectÃ©s" Ã  votre Storybook qui autrement ne pourraient pas Ãªtre rendus Ã  cause de dÃ©pendances contextuelles.

segments.source_content: [**How I Estimate NPM Package Market Share (and how Redux usage compares to other libraries)**](https://blog.isquaredsoftware.com/2022/07/npm-package-market-share-estimates/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)

segments.source_content: Mark Erikson (Redux) explains how he analyzes npm package usage trends, based on various more or less reliable tools. Download stats are often related to CI builds. He uses React state managers as an example. He now estimates Redux / React usage at 33% (previously 45-50%)

translations.fr: Mark Erikson (Redux) explique comment il analyse les tendances d'utilisation des packages npm, en s'appuyant sur divers outils plus ou moins fiables. Les statistiques de tÃ©lÃ©chargement sont souvent liÃ©es aux builds d'intÃ©gration continue. Il utilise les gestionnaires d'Ã©tat React comme exemple. Il estime dÃ©sormais l'utilisation de Redux/React Ã  33% (contre 45-50% auparavant).
translations.en: Mark Erikson (Redux) explique comment il analyse les tendances d'utilisation des packages npm, en s'appuyant sur divers outils plus ou moins fiables. Les statistiques de tÃ©lÃ©chargement sont souvent liÃ©es aux builds d'intÃ©gration continue. Il utilise les gestionnaires d'Ã©tat React comme exemple. Il estime dÃ©sormais l'utilisation de Redux/React Ã  33% (auparavant 45-50%).

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ“œÂ [Next.js: open external links in a New Tab](https://www.seancdavis.com/posts/open-external-nextlink-links-in-a-new-tab/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): it can be interesting to create your own Link abstraction on top of the underlying framework to add extra behavior
- ğŸ“œÂ [The Unlocked Possibilities of the :has() Selector](https://blog.jim-nielsen.com/2022/unlocked-possibilities-of-has-selector/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): CSS feature. Interesting comparison with React rendering at the end.
- ğŸ“œÂ [Atomic Forms in React](https://reaper.is/writing/20220709-atomic-forms?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): presents a bit Jotai-Form and the difference with more traditional approaches like Formik.
- ğŸ“œÂ [Create a simple cookie with Remix](https://jonmeyers.io/blog/create-a-simple-cookie-with-remix?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): shows that the use of cookie in Remix is relatively simple, and close to the HTTP protocol
- ğŸ“œÂ [Yelp - Migrating from Styleguidist to Storybook](https://engineeringblog.yelp.com/2022/07/migrating-from-styleguidist-to-storybook.html?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
- ğŸ“œÂ [Fresh: The Next-Gen JavaScript Web Framework](https://hxrsh.in/blog/fresh?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
- ğŸ“œÂ [Rendering long lists using virtualization with React](https://wanago.io/2022/06/27/long-lists-react-virtualization/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
- ğŸ“œÂ [Component Code Coverage in Cypress v10](https://glebbahmutov.com/blog/component-code-coverage/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
- ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¨Â [Remix + Bun demo](https://twitter.com/ebey_jacob/status/1544608334736592896?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter)
- ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¨Â [React-on-the-edge](https://github.com/vercel-labs/react-on-the-edge?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): Vercel demo that shows how to use React SSR (without Next.js) with the Edge Runtime. With or without streaming.
- ğŸ¦Â [Remix loader type inference](https://twitter.com/kentcdodds/status/1545048020663750661?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): PR merged to facilitate typesafe usage of the useLoaderData() hook ğŸ‘Œ
- ğŸ¦Â [Bun + React SSR](https://twitter.com/jarredsumner/status/1544580094328418304?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): significant performance gains
- ğŸ“¦Â [RemixBlocks](https://javascript.plainenglish.io/remixblocks-ready-to-use-remix-tailwind-css-routes-and-ui-blocks-470a6db70915?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): I find the idea interesting: nested routes Remix are full-stack which makes them a good candidate for copy/paste, quite similar to Tailwind.
- ğŸ“¦Â [react-obsidian](https://github.com/wix-incubator/react-obsidian?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter): dependency injection for React

segments.source_content: Hey! This is Tim from Storetasker. We run the best Shopify dev freelance network. I would love for you to apply if you enjoy building Shopify sites or are excited about leveraging Shopify'sÂ **cutting-edge React framework**Â for building custom storefronts:Â [**Hydrogen**](https://hydrogen.shopify.dev/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter).

J'adorerais que vous postuliez si vous aimez crÃ©er des sites Shopify ou si vous Ãªtes enthousiasmÃ© par l'utilisation du **framework React de pointe** de Shopify pour crÃ©er des storefronts personnalisÃ©s : [**Hydrogen**](https://hydrogen.shopify.dev/?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter).

segments.source_content: Accepted devs on the network work on a freelance basis, and we present them with great opportunities to work on some of the best Shopify brands (Alo Yoga, Chubbies, JUDY & many many more).

segments.source_content: The great thing about Storetasker is that devs aren't in competition with each other - they just pick up the jobs that match their interests. Beyond that - it's a very tight-knit community.

segments.source_content: TechTree is building the firstÂ **social-economic platform for developers**Â - a place to help you unlock the real value of your knowledge and network!

translations.fr: TechTree construit la premiÃ¨re **plateforme socio-Ã©conomique pour dÃ©veloppeurs** - un espace pour vous aider Ã  libÃ©rer la vraie valeur de vos connaissances et de votre rÃ©seau !
translations.en: TechTree construit la premiÃ¨re **plateforme socio-Ã©conomique pour dÃ©veloppeurs** - un lieu pour vous aider Ã  libÃ©rer la valeur rÃ©elle de vos connaissances et de votre rÃ©seau !

segments.source_content: The first major feature on TechTree is Bounties, a tool to help youÂ **earn money by referring your friends**Â to open roles at top VC backed tech startups or find a job that might be right for you!

translations.fr: La premiÃ¨re fonctionnalitÃ© majeure de TechTree est Bounties, un outil pour vous aider Ã  **gagner de l'argent en recommandant vos amis** Ã  des postes ouverts dans des startups technologiques soutenues par des VC ou Ã  trouver un emploi qui pourrait vous convenir !
translations.en: La premiÃ¨re fonctionnalitÃ© majeure de TechTree est Bounties, un outil pour vous aider Ã  **gagner de l'argent en recommandant vos amis** Ã  des postes ouverts dans des startups tech soutenues par des VC ou Ã  trouver un emploi qui vous convient !

segments.source_content: To help show you around, I have gone ahead and created my very ownÂ Bounty boardÂ -Â **a selection of remote, React related roles for you to apply to or refer your network to**. There has been over $300k worth of Bounties claimed on TechTree so far!

segments.source_content: Looking to hire React developers? You can post Bounties of your own to be featured on my Bounty board! Read more and get startedÂ [here](https://www.notion.so/techtreedev/Share-your-jobs-on-my-Bounty-board-c51d2d97d9f3421bab103c42097907ae?utm_campaign=This%20Week%20In%20React&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter).
